maybe you also mean what x-terminal-emulator points to.  In that case, use « sudo update-alternatives --config x-terminal-emulator ».  "shortcut" is too vague; I don't know what shortcut you refer to
x-terminal-emulator in the shell works, but not the shortcut
likely some dconf key you must set then
